content: this legal case involves a dispute over the coownership of a property the court has decided to dissolve the coownership and sell the property through a public auction the proceeds from the sale will be divided among the coowners based on their shares one party requested ownership of a specific part of the building but the court rejected this request the court determined that physically dividing the property was not feasible so a sale was chosen the court also dismissed objections based on statute limitations and accepted the plaintiffs request for a civil division additionally another party made a counterclaim for ownership based on a construction on the property however the court found that the construction was knowingly done on someone elses land so the counterclaim was rejected
